instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Replace <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard
threads.message: Somebody replaced this keyboard on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> model? Is is like <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> or <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> or harder?

threads.title: Replace <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard
threads.message:
Expensive and sucks. tiny shitty screws everywhere. Some good skills required not to fuck up this newer stuff, lots of fragile connectors/cables/screws, you have been warned!
Also forget about popping off the keys if you want to swap to another layout, you will fuck up the butterfly mechanisms unless you have done this 10 times before.

threads.title: Replace <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard
threads.message: Are they still riveted in or only tiny ass screws now?

threads.title: Replace <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> keyboard
threads.message: Screws and glue this time around.
